name: Hotel Gran Sol Ibiza

reviews.text: Amazing value hotel! Very close to beach, cafe mambos and the town. Great service and very friendly. Will be stopping again
reviews.title: Will definitely be coming back!

reviews.text: I stayed in the Gran Sol with my friend just last week, and i must say this is a great hotel! The hotel staff were always friendly and helpful, and the rooms were very clean. The only downfall about the hotel would be the air con, i couldnt breathe when i woke up! But the rooms also have fans so we just used that and it was just as good. There are lots of mirrors - which is handy when there's two girls getting ready! The pool was nice too, i dont understand how this hotel can be a 2 star...i would give it a 5! The location is quite good, far enough from the west end so its very quiet, but still only a 10 minute walk. There is a beach by the hotel, literally about a 2 minute walk, and theres supermarkets on every corner.
reviews.title: best hotel in San Antonio!!!

reviews.text: This is a good value hotel just a stroll from 'sunset strip' (i.e. Cafe Del Mar and Cafe Mambo). The Westend bars are only 10 mins away. The rooms were clean, a decent size (I was on a stag do and staying in a twin room with one of my mates) and the AC came in handy when grabbing a siesta during the afternoon. Breakfast was much better than I expected and at 2€ a pop the bottles of beer at the bar were some of the cheapest bar bought beers we found in Ibiza. This is a nice hotel for couples, families and well behaved stag/hen parties. Thanks for a wonderful stay!
reviews.title: Good value - recommended hotel

reviews.text: My friend and I (we are 2 females aged 23 and 27) have just come back from our third holiday in 4 years to San Antonio, Ibiza and we had the best stay ever at the Hotel Gran Sol. It is only rated as a 2* but do not let this put you off, I would rate it as a 4* without a doubt! It is in an excellent location - 2 mins from the beach (the nice beach in San Antonio - not the horrible one near the West End!), a 5-10 minute walk along to Cafe Mambo / Cafe Del Mar etc, and a 15 minute walk (or a 4 euro taxi ride) from the West End. There's lots of nice cafes / bars / restaurants nearby with beautiful views of the sea. The rooms are basic but very spacious, and we were lucky enough to have a balcony with a sea view! We had air con, a huge fan and a free electronic safe in the room. The hotel pool is really nice too (not massive but big enough), very chilled out - we spent pretty much every day by the pool! We were self catering so I can't comment on the food but if it's as good as everything else in the hotel I'm sure it's great! The staff were very friendly, we literally couldn't have asked for more from this hotel! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who loves Ibiza but would rather keep a distance from the West End experience (we stayed in the West End on our 2 previous holidays and the hotels were horrific). Thank you Hotel Gran Hol for making our holiday the best holiday ever :-)
reviews.title: Will 100% be staying here again, loved the hotel!

reviews.text: Second time we have stayed here. Fantastic hotel, very clean, great location and quiet when you decide to crash out.
reviews.title: Hidden gem of ibiza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived pretty late and were given a room on the first floor. The balcony didn’t give us a view of the ocean unfortunately. That was alright since we were barely home all day. The room was very clean and large. The TV could be upgraded though as it was so small and very high up in the corner of the room. There are 2 beds pushed together that are pretty comfortable. Also there are extra blankets and pillows in the closet. The safe has a digital security code. Bathroom is clean and maids provided extra towels as well. Our reservation didn’t come with the breakfast buffet but we were able to add this on the next day. This was worth it, but just make sure you wake up before 1030am to make it! Not sure what the dinner is like but you can also add this as well at a discounted rate.
reviews.title: very clean and comfortable, tv coud be updated

reviews.text: We were about a block away from the seaside restaurants and just a few more steps was a small beach. If you want to be close enough to the parties but not in the heart of it this is a pretty ideal place to stay. The staff are very nice and the room was very clean and comfortable for our stay.
reviews.title: Great hotel, lovely location, will return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was really nice, very clean and the bar staff where very friendly. Hotel is in a good location just 2 mins from the beach and about 10 mins walk to all the bars and clubs. The pool area was very clean and kept well. The rooms where of grand size and included electronic safe, mini fridge and had a large space balcony. I would recommend this hotel and would certainly return again for a holiday.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel, so glad we chose it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, if only TripAdvisor had been around when I first started coming to Ibiza 10 years ago and I would have discovered Gran Sol! Everytime I have visited I've always stayed somewhere different, but this year I did some research and found Gran Sol, and couldn't believe what a good deal it was and the great reviews! We stayed half board, and were impressed with both breakfast and dinner (get to breakfast early if you want bacon and eggs though!). It is a 2 minute walk from Kanya, and not much further to Mambo, etc. All the staff are really friendly, and when I had to go to hospital due to an ear infection they put food and drink in our room because we missed dinner. Nice clean pool, cheap drinks (and of course cocktails!), occassionally there was evening entertainment too. 2 lifts (there are 6 floors), very clean, I think all rooms have a balcony, most with sea view. All in all, a great stay and will definitely come back next time I'm in Ibiza, thank you Gran Sol!
reviews.title: Hotel is great, service not as much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a great location (once in Ibiza you will need a car, its is mandatory because the island is really big) and the room has all the facilities you will need (including hair dryer and free wifi access). Cleaning is also perfect.
reviews.title: We loved it very much. Good hotel!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights. Emailed the hotel twice regarding our booking and never received a reply. I then found the hotel on Facebook and received a reply after contacting through this. I requested a high floor room with a sea view. Received as requested. Bar staff very friendly pool area lovely. Reception staff friendly. The only thing I thought let the hotel down was the breakfast. Poor quality food we thought. If we were to return I would go room only and eat breakfast out. Other than that very good stay
reviews.title: Good 3 star standard hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Gran Sol is a great hotel with friendly staff!
reviews.title: Third stay and as great as ever!

reviews.text: The rooms have the use of a safe, a fridge, hairdryer, ceiling fan and air-conditioning, all for no extra costs! All rooms have a balcony.
reviews.title: Great hotel, wouldn't hesitate to recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to sleep fine in this hotel, unlike many others in Ibiza, the clientèle are a mixture from children to pensioners, so it is not so much of a party hotel, which I liked.
reviews.title: Second stay at this fab hotel. A definite must!!

reviews.text: The breakfasts had lots of choice on offer, and for only around 3 euros a day are excellent value.
reviews.title: Why is this place only 2 star?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we found the hotel to be absolutely lovely. with big rooms and a nice balcony. We booked it one day in advance were charged around 50 euros a night which is fabulous considering the location and the hotel. its very near the famous westend bars and the sunset strip which has places such as mambo's et al. The bathrooms were neat and comfortable and we couldnt believe that this was a two star hotel.the pool is nice and beautiful with a nice friendly bar.. I recommend anyone who goes to ibiza to stay on sant antoni side to definitely go and stay here. its not a very noisy neighbourhood but still is very close to all the action . Also, the staff was very friendly and provided us with everything we asked for. My only problem was that the wifi would not work in the rooms and would only work in the lobby.
reviews.title: a fabulous hotel with a perfect location

reviews.text: I have just come back from ibiza,where i stayed at this hotel and could not belive it is only classed as a 2 star. Upon arriving,the reception is very clean and bright and staff great and pleasant. The room i booked was for 2 lads sharing and was very good indeed,with air con,ceiling fan and safe and tv all free.Rooms were cleaned every day,with fresh towels and clean sheets even if we had a lay in and didn't leave room till after 12pm.
reviews.title: Well worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area is very clean and tidy,with free sunbeds for you to lay on as and when you requier. This hotel seems to be very popular with "stag and hen" parties and i have sometimes had bad experiances with noise,shouting and swearing,along with banging of doors at silly o'clock,but on this trip i had no problems what so ever. All groups were having fun,but also very well behaved.Food i found to be ok too,but didnt eat in the restraunt,only the bar,but i guess was cooked by same chefs etc. you can get a good salad,burger or pizza and drink for around 7-8 euros.
reviews.title: Excellent!!

reviews.text: To sumerise,value for money i think this is a fantastic hotel to stay,i paid £243 for the week room only and found it brilliant.
reviews.title: This is the hotel you want

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Sometimes, you really can believe everything you read :-)

description: The family-managed Gran Sol Hotel is one of San Antonio's favourite, modestly priced hotels: it lies in a quieter corner of the resort just a short walk away from the town centre and beach of San Antonio.There is a fresh-water swimming-pool on a spacious sun-terrace complete with loungers and sun-shades. There is also a garden with lawn for more serious sunbathing.The small sandy beach of Caló d'es Moro is less than 100m from the hotel whilst the beaches of Cala Grassio and more sophisticated Cala Grassioneta are a stroll down the coast.
